headline: Why one analyst says Shopify is a buy over its AI use
summary: Loop Capital Markets gets bullish on Shopify (SHOP), upgrading the stock to a Buy and lifting its price target on the e-commerce company.  Loop Capital Markets Managing Director Anthony Chukumba tells Market Domination's Julie Hyman and Josh Lipto that Shopify’s internal use of AI is helping with efficiency and "keeping their expense base pretty stable." Chukumba adds that Shopify has become “even more attractive” to enterprise merchants. However, the smaller businesses Shopify represents still faces hefty competition from retail giants such as Walmart (WMT), with Chukumba believing the big-box retailer to be “hitting on all cylinders in a way we haven't seen for some time.” To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Walmart, Amazon holiday spending rise as Target, Best Buy stumble - data
summary: Walmart Inc, Amazon.com and fast-growing e-commerce sites Shein and PDD Holding's Temu saw record-breaking sales on Black Friday and Cyber Monday, according to spending data, suggesting that they may finish the holiday season on a much stronger note than Target and Best Buy, which struggled. Holiday shoppers largely browsed at brick-and-mortar stores, making more online purchases at some retailers, snapping up such items as pre-owned Rolex watches, Pokemon cards and singer Sabrina Carpenter's perfumes at Walmart, and Fire TV streaming devices and Shark vacuums at Amazon during the deal-heavy week, which at Amazon began on Nov. 21, according to company statements.

headline: Best Stock to Buy Right Now: Walmart vs. Costco
summary: Walmart (NYSE: WMT) and Costco Wholesale (NASDAQ: COST) are two of the most dominant retailers in the world.  In the case of Costco and Walmart's Sam's Club, they also have the advantage of a membership model.  Walmart and Costco have similar business models, but there are also some important differences.

headline: Walmart’s Newest Director Bought Up the Surging Stock
summary: Walmart  stock has been surging in 2024, and the retailer’s newest director just bought a large block of shares.  Walmart has seen shares soar more than 70% so far this year, trouncing the gain in the  Consumer confidence has been shaky at times in 2024, but Walmart’s earnings have been strong.  Director Bob Moritz paid $500,000 on Nov. 27 for 5,446 Walmart shares, an average price of $91.81 each.
